results.title: Along the power lines
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Shan Benson
results.brief_description: The story of electrical power in Victoria from generating stations to consumer. Shows the prompt action taken with mobile radio-controlled teams, when break downs in supply are reported; causes of breakdowns such as lightning. Power generated from power stations at Eildon- Rubicon, the Snowy Mountains, and the Latrobe Valley is directed by engineers at the main control centre near Melbourne to main terminal stations, and on to the consumer. Electricity is distributed at high voltage over long distances, this means danger but skilled linesmen trained in safe techniques patrol existing lines and erect new ones supplying over 90 per cent of Victoria’s industrial power.

results.title: Along the beach
results.creator_credit: Firebird Films, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: This film has no dialogue, however it’s evocative soundtrack and beautiful visuals are extremely touching. A young boy runs along the beach on Stradbroke Island off Queensland, absorbed by the shimmering, rhythmic waves, and the textures, shadows and patterns of all he sees on the sand - the footprints of tiny creatures, the undulating sand shapes sculptured by the ocean currents, the shells and seaweed and the shadowy fish trapped in a pool. Music: Nancy Tow. No other credits available.

results.title: Alone: life wastes Andy Hardy
results.brief_description: An experimental film that monstrously inflates a few seconds of old Andy Hardy footage into a wickedly subversive deconstruction of an Oedipal triangle. Throwing down the gauntlet to Hollywood’s space/time system, Arnold tears asunder the film language of classic Hollywood cinema. By surgically sectioning single frames and reproducing them in multiplied and repeated sequences, he exposes the repressed sexual dynamics between Andy (Mickey Rooney), his girlfriend Betsy (Judy Garland) and Mrs Hardy (Fay Holden).

results.title: Alone at home
results.creator_credit: Alfred Higgins Productions and Stephen Wallen
results.brief_description: Clearly outlines procedures that children should be aware of when circumstances necessitate their remaining at home on their own. Highlights the need to keep a list of important phone numbers handy and when to use them; the need to be wary of letting strangers into the house or letting them know parents are out; how to work locks, thermostats etc… Suitable for years prep-6.

results.title: Aloise
results.creator_credit: Alain Dahan and Liliane de Kermadec
results.brief_description:
The painful life of a mentally unstable but highly gifted woman is unveiled in this film, based on episodes from the life of an actual person. Aloise creates a series of haunting drawings while she is incarcerated in an institution for the insane in turn-of-the-century Switzerland. She endures torments as a musically gifted girl and later as a young woman; her developing madness and the barbaric treatments of the time are shown.

Credits: Producer, Alain Dahan ; director, Liliane de Kermadec ; writers, Liliane de Kermadec, Andre Techine ; photography, Jean Penzer.
Cast: Roger Blin, Delphine Seyrig, Jacques Weber, Isabelle Huppert, Julien Guiomar, Michel Lonsdale.

results.title: Almost famous [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Vinyl Films, Ian Bryce and Cameron Crowe
results.brief_description: Director Cameron Crowe’s experience as a teenage journalist for “Rolling Stone” magazine was the inspiration for this academy award winning film. Set in the 1970s, William Miller (Patrick Fugit) lives with his loving but over-protective mother Elaine (Frances McDormand), rebelling against her by writing music reviews for an underground newspaper. He is discovered by Lester Bangs (Philip Seymour Hoffman), editor of a controversial rock magazine, and is hired to review a Black Sabbath concert. While he is unable to review the band, he interviews opening act ‘Stillwater’, and the resulting article gains the attention of “Rolling Stone” magazine. Despite his mother’s distrust in the world of rock music, William joins Stillwater on tour, becomes friends with the band, falls for leader of the ‘Band-aids’, Penny Lane (Kate Hudson), and discovers what really goes on behind the scenes in the rock and roll world. Cast includes Billy Crudup, Jason Lee, Anna Paquin, Fairuza Balk, Noah Taylor, Bijou Phillips and Zooey Deschanel. (Awards: Academy Awards, Cameron Crowe for Best Screenplay).

results.title: Almost everything you ever wanted to know about motivating people or Maslow's hierarchy of needs
results.brief_description: Instructional film which uses psychologist Abraham Maslow’s “Hierarchy of needs” model to explore how to increase worker productivity. The model posits five levels of need - physiological, security, social, esteem and finally, and most importantly, self-actualisation. Film uses short, fictional, badly acted scenarios to illustrate how each need can be satisfied in the workplace, and how damaging it is if each need is not satisfied. The point is made explicit that we don’t satisfy worker needs for their benefit, because it is humane and civilised, but because a happy worker will be more efficient and productive, thus more profitable.

results.title: Almost everyone does
results.creator_credit: Wombat Productions, Inc. and Gene Feldman
results.brief_description: Scenes from an average middle-class family illustrate what they do to unwind- martinis, smoking, chatting, pills. The film asks, “When does a drug that changes the way a person feels become harmful or dangerous?”. Emphasises that all people have good and bad feelings, and suggests how people learn to cope with them. Explores alternatives to coping with bad feelings without recourse to drugs.
